instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165, No Power, PPBUS Bouncing from 8.4v - 8.59v
threads.message:
Board had liquid damage to area between LVDS and U7090, then down about 2 inches, stopping right above Q7130. Board has green light, but no fan. Rails seem present, but ppbus is bouncing from ~8.4v to 8.6v pretty rapidly. Same increments over and over (i.e., reads at 8.56, then down to 8.42, to 8.50, to 8.59v, back down to 8.42v, etc). I can't recall what usually causes this type of cycling, but feel like it may be related to a mosfet not functioning properly.

Any advice would be appreciated--thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165, No Power, PPBUS Bouncing from 8.4v - 8.59v
threads.message: Got this solved; U5110 was no good. Looked great from parts board, but was constantly resetting my SMC. Replaced and got fan spin. I still have a ton of work to do near the LVDS, and may post back (please don't close just yet); I'll post an update once board is fully operational. Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165, No Power, PPBUS Bouncing from 8.4v - 8.59v
threads.message: OK, looks like this unit is fixed at this point. You can close this one and mark solved--thanks!
